5051.29.text: rolled clean around in his head, and he died.

5056.45.text:
Then while I stood, transfixed with rage and
despair, seeing my crown, my empire, every

5065.98.text:
hope and every ambition, my very life, lying
prostrate there with the dead master, they

5075.03.text:
came, seized me from behind, and bound me
until my veins stood out like cords, and my

5081.18.text:
voice failed with the paroxysms of my frenzied
screams.

5085.88.text:
But I still raged, bleeding and infuriated
among them, and more than one policeman felt

5092.93.text:
Then when I could no longer move they came
nearer; I saw old Hawberk, and behind him

5099.93.text:
my cousin Louis' ghastly face, and farther
away, in the corner, a woman, Constance, weeping

5111.22.text: "You have seized the throne and the empire.

5113.91.text:
Woe! woe to you who are crowned with the crown
of the King in Yellow!"

5124.00.text:
Mr. Castaigne died yesterday in the Asylum
for Criminal Insane.]

5132.46.text:
The End of The Repairer Of Reputations in
The King In Yellow by Robert W Chambers
